item.title: How I Approach Market Sizing
item.description:
Market sizing is one of the most fundamental consulting skills. Here is my approach.

The Framework

I typically use a combination of top-down and bottom-up approaches.

Top-Down

Start with the total addressable market and narrow down:

Total Market then Segment then Geography then Target Customers

Bottom-Up

Build up from unit economics:

Price x Volume x Customers = Market Size

Key Principles

  1. Triangulate - Use multiple methods and cross-check
  2. Document assumptions - Make them explicit and defensible
  3. Sensitivity analysis - Test what happens if you are wrong

Research and Projects

A collection of my analytical work and strategic projects.

Academic Research

Geographic Concentration in Global Semiconductor Manufacturing

Python, SQL | 2025-2026

Analysed the $500B global semiconductor market to assess supply chain concentration risk for corporate and government decision-makers.

Key Findings:

  • Despite $95B in government subsidies, market concentration increased
  • Taiwan’s 31% market share represents an irreplaceable ecosystem
  • US manufacturing costs 56% more than Taiwan equivalents
  • Ecosystem factors (talent, suppliers, infrastructure) matter more than subsidies
